channel.title: Running Android Apps inside Kicksecure - Waydroid
channel.description:
From my testing, Waydroid appears to be very buggy and not fully compatible with the default Kicksecure at the moment. For example:
- Kicksecure uses xfce 4.18, which still doesn't support Wayland by default. - Installing KDE, which supports Wayland, will cause the sdwdate-gui systray not to appear because it doesn't support Wayland (there's a [ticket already open for this](https://forums.whonix.org/t/make-sure-whonix-tools-support-wayland/12324)). - Waydroid has blocking issues when running on Debian, even if iptables is installed:
- [Issue 903](https://github.com/waydroid/waydroid/issues/903) - [Issue 900](https://github.com/waydroid/waydroid/issues/900)
Installing waydroid inside kicksecure stopped here.
-----
Reversing the ways:
Install Kicksecure inside [Waydroid-Linux](https://waydro.id/#wdlinux) customized Debian version:
- They say it's based on Debian bookworm, which is stable, but actually, if you install the OS, the repos are sid, not bookworm. A ticket has been created:
https://github.com/waydroid/waydroid/issues/1027
- Blocker: Kicksecure doesn't support the unstable Debian version.
Installing Kicksecure inside waydroid stopped here.
